intro: Psychotria lanceifolia, commonly known as the "Crimson Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, bright red flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in tropical rainforests. Psychotria lanceifolia is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its striking floral display.
